medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute bilateral ptosis, nystagmus, and extraocular muscle weakness.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed abrupt onset of severe bilateral ptosis at age 26. Nystagmus and extraocular motor paresis were also noted. The ptosis did not improve with edrophonium. The patient had a history of developmental milestones until age 8, followed by gait, speech, and intellectual abnormalities.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Undefined progressive multisystem neurodegenerative disorder; cognitive dysfunction since age 13; mild spastic gait and bilateral hyperreflexia; previous cognitive evaluations showed low IQ scores.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes maternal grandfather diagnosed with LHON and was blind, and a maternal great aunt who was also blind with a relative who experienced subacute blindness.
medical_history.social_history: Attended special education classes; never employed; continued to live at home.
